field.name: summary
field.value: Poor performance while running in Debug Mode inside Visual Studio 2005

field.name: description
field.value:
I'm building a 2-tiers application using NHibernate which uses DynamicProxy 1.1.5. I'm experiencing performance issues at my application startup and I discovered that it is due to the DynamicProxy generation. I'm always using the method : CreateProxy(Type[] interfaces, IInterceptor interceptor, new object()); For 10 types to generate in DEBUG MODE : it takes 27 seconds if I use one single ProxyGenerator instance and 11 seconds if I use a ProxyGenerator instance per type In NON DEBUG MODE : it takes respectively 2.5 seconds in the first case and 3 seconds in the second case (so no big difference in NON DEBUG MODE)
Do you have an idea why performances are so BAD when running in Debug mode (which is very important while developping the application) ? Is there a solution ? Thanks a lot for your help !

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: Is this issue still relevant? I don't have VS05 and was not able to reproduce this in VS08

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: As far as I know this is the bug in BCL and there is no workaround for it, so there is nothing we can do.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
With the help of Rob Redmond we found that the issue lies in TypeBuilder._TermCreateClass method, which is an unmanaged method.
At this point only thing we can do is to create a reproduction and submit this to Microsoft Connect, and then hope they'll be willing to fix that for .NET 6.0

comment.author: perlun
comment.text:
I ran into this problem recently, and it was quite annoying. However, I did some testing now with Visual Studio 2010, beta 2.
I recompiled my own projects with .NET 4.0, no change (still the bad performance).
I recompiled DynamicProxy with .NET 4.0 as well, and *now* the bug is actually _gone_!!! Which is way cool, great news for us, since DynamicProxy plays a key role in this project.
So, no need to wait for .NET 6.0; this will very likely work with the final version of .NET 4.0 as well.
